meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Cate Hollenbeck Jim Read Karen Ash Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6995.

td.p: Cate Hollenbeck, a trust officer from Los Angeles, California
Jim Read, a professor of English from Arroyo Grande, California
Karen Ash, a business analyst from Brooklyn, New York (whose 1-day cash winnings total $23,600)

tr.td: PABLO PICASSO SAID
"D" BRIEFING
HODGEPODGE
CANNE PALME D'OR WINNERS
(Alex: Movies, of course.)
BOOKS ABOUT PRESIDENTS
(Jimmy: Three things Chicagoans enjoy from the legendary Gino's East.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Whoever wins today will win a lot of money, I believe, and get to relax for two weeks, and I\'ll tell you about that in a moment.)
...
(Alex: [To Cate] No, he was working on a steam engine, but you are incorrect with that response.)
...
(Alex: [To Karen] It\'s the origin of the term "horsepower". ... And you get to rest for two weeks, because on Monday, we begin our annual Teachers Tournament.)
CateWhat is a steam engine
$5,501
JimWhat are men?
$12,795
KarenWhat are horses?
$10,000
horses')
